thread.title: Dream Boats: Yachts you can buy for $10M
thread.title_full: Dream Boats: Yachts you can buy for $10M

title: Dream Boats: Yachts you can buy for $10M
text:
The Westport 130 tri-deck, first introduced in 2001, has four staterooms plus crew quarters, an exercise room, sauna and skylounge. Length: 130 feet. Beam: 26 feet. Year: 2007. Price: $10,500,000. Contact: Westport. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2007/Westport-Tri-Deck-Motoryacht-2851788/Halifax/Canada#.VeXS6Fb0j8F Westport LLC Fullscreen The Westport 130 salon interior is appointed with elegant mahogany throughout, accented with cream and red. Camm Moore Fullscreen The mansion-like staterooms on the Westport 130 are paneled in warm mahogany with nautical accents. Camm Moore Fullscreen Whether for lounging or entertaining, the Westport exterior spaces provide plenty of space. Camm Moore Fullscreen The Proteksan Turquoise tri-deck was built in Turkey in 2002 and has been extensively refitted. Length: 140 feet. Beam: 28 feet. Year: 2002. Price: $9,950,000. Contact: Northrop and Johnson, Inc. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2002/Proteksan-Turquoise-Tri-Deck-2849547/Fort-Lauderdale/FL/United-States#.VeXaRlb0j8F Billy Black Fullscreen The Proteksan Turquoise salon is an unexpected explosion of color. Billy Black Fullscreen The six staterooms in the Proteksan Turquoise also feature bright color combinations. Billy Black Fullscreen The sun deck on the Proteksan Turquoise features a welcoming hot tub surrounded by lounging sofas. Billy Black Fullscreen The graceful line of this aluminum-hulled Burger 122 hints at its builder's maritime heritage dating back to the 19th century. Length: 122 feet. Beam: 26 feet, 5 inches. Year: 2002. Price: $9,950,000. Contact: Northrop and Johnson, Inc. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2002/Burger--2635249/Palm-Beach/FL/United-States#.VeTjw1b0j8E Northrop and Johnson Fullscreen The Burger 122 salon has traditional appeal, appointed in cherry with custom cabinetry and intricate detailing. Virtuals Inc Fullscreen The Burger 122 great room includes a custom dining table and built-in, marble-top buffet. Virtuals Inc Fullscreen The Burger 122 staterooms are a study in opulence, crafted from cherry with shoji screens and accented with burgundy and gold. Virtuals Inc Fullscreen The Burger 122 pilothouse is crafted from cherry with a custom ship's wheel and a raised leather settee crowned by a maritime bronze relief. Virtuals Inc Fullscreen The Horizon P110 tri-deck is crowned with a flybridge featuring a sky-high Jacuzzi with a 360-degree bird's-eye view. Length: 110 feet. Beam: 23 feet, 6 inches. Year: 2013. Price: $9,900,000. Contact: Horizon Yacht USA. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2013/Horizon-P110-2527236/North-Palm-Beach/FL/United-States#.VdNhwFb0j8E Horizon Yachts Fullscreen The main deck on the Horizon P110 houses a large salon accented with South American walnut, a formal dining room and full galley. Horizon Yachts Fullscreen The focal point of the Horizon P110 dining room is an iridescent shell wall feature framed on both sides by custom glass display cases. Horizon Yachts Fullscreen The Horizon P110 has multiple outdoor spaces to enjoy lounging or entertaining. Horizon Yachts Fullscreen The sleek 100-foot Custom Line employs two types of stabilization technology, gyro for greater comfort at anchor and fin stabilization for stability at speed. Length: 100 feet. Beam: 23 feet, 9 inches. Year: 2012. Price: $9,750,000. Contact: MarineMax. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2012/Custom-Line-100-2639552/NY/United-States#.VdNinlb0j8E Heather McKean Fullscreen The Custom Line reflects a recent trend in large yachts: providing a more intimate view of the water with the use of spacious windows. Heather McKean Fullscreen The Custom Line decks have copious exterior entertaining and lounging space, including an opening transom for launching watercraft and a foldout platform called a "teak beach." Heather McKean Fullscreen The Custom Line features a fold-out aquatic Juliet balcony with full sliding doors off the main salon. Heather McKean Fullscreen Where most staterooms have small portlights, the Custom Line's five cabins have picture windows for a more open and airy feel. Heather McKean Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide The Horizon P110 has multiple outdoor spaces to enjoy lounging or entertaining. (Photo: Horizon Yachts)
11 CONNECT 48 TWEET 1 LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Nothing says you’ve arrived more spectacularly than making an entrance on a superyacht (witness the parody video, I’m On a Boat .*) For more than a century, the rich and famous have made a splash with their own yachts, including Hollywood A-listers Johnny Carson, Johnny Depp and Steven Spielberg, musicians Eric Clapton and Bono, and pro golfer Tiger Woods.
Privately owned luxury yachts are an invention of the 20th century. Boatbuilders began crafting the first recreational yachts for the ultra wealthy in the early 1900s, although it wasn’t until mid-century that owning a superyacht became a thing, thanks in part to Greek shipping magnate Aristotle Onassis.
In 1954, Onassis, who later married President Kennedy’s widow, Jackie, bought a 300-plus foot Canadian frigate and poured millions into making it the world’s first floating playground for the rich and famous. Onboard the lavish Christina O , Hollywood starlets rollicked with American millionaires, princes, kings and world leaders, setting a new high-water mark for extravagant one-upmanship.
USATODAY
Cruise ship tours: Christina O
Shipyards that had traditionally built navy and merchant vessels began building luxury yachts during the ‘60s and ‘70s in response to new demand. The megayacht industry expanded and contracted with the world economy, experiencing its lowest ebbs after Black Monday in 1987 and the Great Crash of 2008. Its greatest surge occurred during the late ‘90s IT boom when luxury yachts supersized from 75 feet up to more than 200 feet ( see a list of the biggest ones here ).
Today’s yachts can exceed 500 feet — and $500 million, giving birth to the term "giga-yacht," and the supersizing war still rages. The largest giga-yacht to date, Azzam, completed in 2013 by German shipyard Lürssen Yachts, is a whopping 590 feet, the length of two football fields end-to-end. Azzam eclipsed Eclipse, owned by Russian millionaire Roman Abramovich, which held the previous record at 536 feet.
These palatial behemoths grow ever more ostentatious, sporting helicopter pads (and hangars), swimming pools, submarines, discos, beauty salons and a belly full of water toys.
USA TODAY
Dream big: Beautiful sailboats you can buy for $1M
Luxury yachts have a minimum of three decks. The lower deck houses a swim platform for easy water access, the engine room, four or five guest cabins and crew quarters. The main deck sees the most action with the salon, galley, formal dining area and owner’s suite. The upper deck typically has a second salon, an exterior lounging/party deck and the bridge. The largest yachts have additional decks for whatever indulgences an owner can imagine and a builder can create.
The vessels roam the world’s waters, often splitting season between the Caribbean and Mediterranean. Most are planing hulls, rising out of the water at cruising speed, which, despite their size, allows them to travel at speeds above 20 knots.
USA TODAY
Dream Boats: Catamarans you can buy for $1 million
While owning a super-, mega- or giga-yacht is out of reach for all but the ultra-wealthy, it’s fascinating to peek inside the Dream Boats on the market. Our photo gallery takes a look at 100- to 140-foot luxury yachts listed for around $10 million.
*The boat T-Pain boarded to record I’m On a Boat , Never Say Never , a 130-foot Sunseeker Predator, is currently listed for $11.2 million.
USA TODAY
Dream Boats: Trawlers you can buy for $1 million
To see sailboats you can buy for $1 million, click through the gallery below:
The 72-foot Alden, a collaborative design, was built in 1995 but has undergone extensive refitting in 2006. Although the working cockpit is aft, there is a clever center cockpit lounging area with seating and table. Length: 72 feet. Draft: Min.: 9'6", max.: 12'6". Year: 1995. Price: $995,000. Contact: charlestonharboryachtsales.com. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/1995/Alden-72-Aft-Cockpit-2529300/Charleston/SC/United-States#.VV9xc1b0j8E Handout Fullscreen Despite having a center cockpit lounge above, the living area is spacious and accommodating, with three cabins plus a double-berth crew cabin. Matthew Cohen Fullscreen The master stateroom, just below the aft cockpit, stretches the width of the boat, and like the rest of the interior is crafted of solid teak and has an ensuite bathroom with shower stall. Matthew Cohen Fullscreen The Swedes are known as hardy, competent sailors and so are their boats. This fiberglass hull Hallberg-Rassy offers an array of sailing configurations with a single mast sloop rig and an added, permanent cutter stay with hydraulic roller furling. Length: 62 feet. Draft: 8'2". Year: 2004. Price: $995,000. Contact: freestateyachts.com. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2004/Hallberg-Rassy-62-2686144/Annapolis/MD/United-States#.VV9wRFb0j8E Tom Might Fullscreen Hallberg-Rassys are popular with liveaboard sailors for their all-business exterior combined with a homey layout below providing ample, comfortable living space. Tom Might Fullscreen Taking maximum advantage of the 62-foot waterline, the cabin space below has four cabins and two heads – and a bathtub, a rare sight on a sailing vessel. Tom Might Fullscreen This 60-foot aluminum hull Harman, designed by the Dutch design group Dykstra Naval Architects, is a sleek cutter (one mast, three sails) with an eye for both cruising and sailing. Length: 60 feet. Draft: 8'5". Year: 2013. Price: $932,365. Contact: harmanyachts.com. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2013/Harman-60-Dykstra-Design-Aluminum-Cutter-2693192/Turkey#.VV5GEFb0j8E Burcu Uysal Fullscreen Abovedecks, this Harman 60 comes with all-hydraulic sailing gear for single-handing, and wide, open teak decks and a generous cockpit for ease of movement underway. Burcu Uysal Fullscreen Below, the Harman 60 has three cabins and two bathrooms with a fresh, contemporary feel. Burcu Uysal Fullscreen This elegant gaff-rigged schooner (two masts), built in 1999 in Seattle, is an authorized copy of Design # 73 by L. Francis Herreshoff, a boat designer and naval architect who died in 1972. Length: 75 feet. Draft: 6'3". Year: 1999. Price: $950,000. Contact: jordanyachts.com. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2000/Legendary-Yachts-Herreshoff-Schooner-2819841/-Ft-Lauderdale/FL/United-States#.VV49a1b0j8E Jordan Yacht & Ship Co. Fullscreen The traditional Herreshoff design has been brought into the 21st century with modern materials, including carbon fiber masts and electric winches. Jordan Yacht & Ship Co. Fullscreen Below, she has been fitted out with mahogany and white beaded paneling, with two large staterooms for the captain plus extra bunks for crew. Jordan Yacht & Ship Co. Fullscreen This fetching 58-foot Little Harbor, designed by Ted Hood, is a cutter rig with twin cockpits, one aft and one amidships. Built in 1989, she has undergone extensive upgrades in recent years. Length: 58 feet. Draft: 6'. Year: 1989. Price: $945,000. Contact: davidwaltersyachts.com. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/1989/Little-Harbor--2517036/Lake-Worth/FL/United-States#.VWx_Jlb0j8G Handout Fullscreen Below, the Little Harbor 58, finished in teak and decorated in green and gold, feels both cozy and expansive. Three cabins can accommodate seven people. Handout Fullscreen The centerpiece of the Little Harbor's spacious main salon is an inviting semi-circular dining area finished in cushy Ultrasuede. Handout Fullscreen This 45-foot ketch (two masts, aft mast in front of rudder) is a modern interpretation of a classic design by legendary sailboat designers Sparkman & Stephens, rendered with modern materials. Length: 45 feet. Draft: Min.: 4'5", max.: 7'3". Year: 2010. Price: $934,400. Contact: sandemanyachtcompany.co.uk. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2010/Sparkman-%26-Stephens-Yawl-2757018/Australia#.VV5CClb0j8E Sandeman Yacht Company Fullscreen The S&S salon is a classic design, with berths above the settees and a centerline dropleaf table under a light-friendly butterfly hatch. Sandeman Yacht Company Fullscreen The S&S forecabin also follows a traditional arrangement, with a double stateroom forward of the main mast with berths on each side. Sandeman Yacht Company Fullscreen The Trintella 75 cutter (one mast, three sails) is a fully modern sailing yacht. This 75-foot luxury cruiser is a Dutch vessel designed by Van de Stadt Design and built at Trintella Shipyard. Length: 75 feet. Draft: 9'4". Year: 1993. Price: $990,000. Contact: vicsail.com. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/1993/Van-de-Stadt-Trintella-75-2289924/Auckland/New-Zealand#.VWuByFb0j8F Vicsail Sydney Fullscreen The sailing features of the Trintella 75 include twin helm stations, a carbon mast and hydraulic furling on the foresails. Vicsail Sydney Fullscreen Below, the Trintella has contemporary, luxurious accommodations, five cabins and many creature comforts -- including a washing machine. Vicsail Sydney Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide To see catamarans you can buy for $1 million, click through the gallery below:
The Lagoon 52 sails under a fully battened main with a furling Genoa and Gennaker. (Sister ship pictured.) Length: 52 feet. Beam: 28 feet. Year: 2013. Price: $950,000. Contact: NG Yachting. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2013/Lagoon-52-2827399/United-States#.VX8rw1b0j8F Nicolas Claris Fullscreen The Lagoon 52's interior of blond wood feels light and airy. The galley and salon are spacious enough to accommodate the whole crew. Nicolas Claris Fullscreen The Lagoon 52 features four guest cabins with ensuite baths and enough living space to rival a hotel room. Nicolas Claris Fullscreen The Leopard 62 features a spacious flybridge separate from the cockpit. This boat has undergone many upgrades including a recent repower. Length: 62 feet. Beam: 30 feet. Year: 2003. Price: $849,000. Contact: Leopard Catamarans. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2003/Robertson-And-Caine-Leopard-62-2788834/British-Virgin-Islands#.VX8tEVb0j8E M Tempest Fullscreen This Leopard 62's refurnished interior has a light, tropical feel, with generous accommodations for 10 guests plus separate crew quarters. M Tempest Fullscreen The Leopard 62's spacious cabin has an ensuite shower and head plus an additional vanity/desk area. M Tempest Fullscreen The Privilege 615 has a mid-level helm station between the flybridge and deck, and comes rigged with a fully battened main, Genoa and Gennaker. Length: 61 feet. Beam: 30 feet. Year: 2008. Price: $999,999. Contact: Denison Yacht Sales. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2008/Privilege-615-2848936/Fort-Lauderdale/FL/United-States#.VX8rSVb0j8F Privilege Yachts Fullscreen Each Privilege has a custom interior and varies from boat to boat. This one has a bright and welcoming tone with a huge salon, four cabins and plenty of extras. Ted Swaboda Fullscreen As with many catamarans, the Privilege's cockpit deck is the best room in the house. It features ample seating for the whole crew and full enclosure in case of inclement weather. Ted Swaboda Fullscreen The Sunreef 62 is a semi-custom sloop rig built in Poland. The generous cockpit features a fiberglass flybridge with lots of lounging space. Length: 62 feet. Beam: 30 feet. Year: 2008. Price: $995,000. Contact: Southern Trade Yacht Sales. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2008/Sunreef-Sunreef-62-2681515/ROAD-TOWN%2C-Tortola/British-Virgin-Islands#.VYnfFFb0j8E Norman Clothier Fullscreen Appointed in white leather and wood below, the Sunreef 62 has four double guest cabins, each with a private bath. Jim Grant Fullscreen The back deck on the Sunreef 62 rivals that of many houses, with wraparound seating and two huge, easy-access coolers. Jim Grant Fullscreen This Voyage 52 has an open aft cockpit and is rigged with a fully battened main and furling Genoa. Length: 52 feet. Beam: 27 feet. Year: 2014. Price: $925,000. Contact: Voyage Yacht Sales. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2014/Voyage-Yachts-520-2810420/British-Virgin-Islands#.VYx5rVb0j8G Brynley Rathbun Fullscreen Below, the Voyage 52 has a contemporary look with accommodations for 11 plus a separate crew cabin and pilot berth. Brynley Rathbun Fullscreen The Voyage 52 comes with all the creature comforts including a watermaker, ice maker and air conditioning. Brynley Rathbun Fullscreen This 2011 Wave 58 features a centerline helm to optimize 360-degree visibility for docking, shown here with a fully battened main and a billowy light air spinnaker. Length: 58 feet. Beam: 30 feet. Year: 2011. Price: $890,00. Contact: Berger Yacht Sales. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2011/Wave-58-2598397/Szczecin/Poland#.VYxyRFb0j8F Wave Shipyard Fullscreen Below, the Wave 58 has sleek, modern decor and accommodates eight guests and two crew in four double and two single berths. Wave Shipyard Fullscreen This view of the Wave 58 from atop the mast demonstrates the generous space available abovedecks on a 30-foot-wide boat, one of the best benefits of a two-hull boat. Wave Shipyard Fullscreen Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Autoplay Show Thumbnails Show Captions Last Slide Next Slide To see trawlers you can buy for $1 million, click through the gallery below:
The Fleming 55 has a charmingly flared bow and a semi-displacement hull allowing it to run at 16 knots, cruising speed. In addition to the traditional pilothouse, it has a second helm in the partially enclosed flybridge. Length: 55 feet. Beam: 16 feet. Year: 2002. Price: $949,000. Contact: Burr Yacht Sales. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2002/Fleming-55-PHMY-2791819/United-States#.VarAbVb0j8G Nickalous O'Flaherty Fullscreen The homey and open salon in the Fleming 55, finished in teak, is a multipurpose space with a coffee table that converts to a dining table. Nickalous O'Flaherty Fullscreen Trawler pilothouses are the envy of every captain. Part business, part entertainment area, the pilothouse is a climate-controlled gathering spot to watch the view and the action. Nickalous O'Flaherty Fullscreen The Fort Myers 74 has both an enclosed pilothouse and an open flybridge. There is no shortage of space to entertain abovedecks. Length: 74 feet. Beam: 22 feet. Year: 1992. Price: $1,100,000. Contact: Fraser Yachts. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/1992/Fort-Myers-Trawler-LRC-2727924/San-Diego/CA/United-States#.VbfFUlb0j8G David J Shuler Photography Fullscreen Below, this Fort Myers 74 feels bright and open, appointed in Canadian maple and decorated in cream, yellow and blue. Condo or trawler? Hard to tell. David J Shuler Photography Fullscreen The Fort Myers 74 accommodates six guests in three spacious staterooms with room for two more guests on a pullout queen settee in the salon. David J Shuler Photography Fullscreen Kadey-Krogens, with their full displacement hulls and wine glass sterns, are known for seakindliness, offering a smooth ride through waves. This 58 has a comfortable pilothouse and open flybridge. Length: 58 feet. Beam: 18 feet, 10 inches. Year: 2002. Price: $995,000. Contact: Kadey-Krogen Yachts. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2002/Kadey-Krogen-58%27-2704036/Stuart/FL/United-States#.VaPs5lb0j8F Sonja Carr Fullscreen Below, this Kadey-Krogen 58 has a floorplan ideal for a cruising couple, with a roomy salon, large master stateroom and an open office with two work areas. Dona Corbett Fullscreen The Kadey-Krogen 58's galley opens to the salon and features ample Corian-topped counters for prep and cooking. Dona Corbett Fullscreen The Kadey-Krogen 58's spacious master stateroom has a walk-around queen bed. The floor plan includes a guest stateroom with twin bunks and an open office area. Dona Corbett Fullscreen This sturdy Nordhavn 57 was the first motorized production boat to make the Northwest passage from Rhode Island to Seattle, documented in the book "The Other Side of the Ice." Length: 57 feet. Beam: 17 feet, 1 inch. Year: 2000. Price: $849,000. Contact: Yacht Tech/James Knight and Assoc. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2000/Nordhavn-57-2817012/Palm-Beach-Gardens/United-States#.VaPyNVb0j8F Sprague Theobald Fullscreen The Nordhavn 57, all business on the outside, surprises with a warm and homey atmosphere down below with an open galley and convertible coffee/dining table. Paul Pelletier Fullscreen The Nordhavn 57 has three staterooms, two with island queen beds and one with bunks. Paul Pelletier Fullscreen The Nordic Tugs 49 has a classic trawler profile with a flared bow and enclosed pilothouse with no flybridge. Length: 49 feet. Beam: 16 feet, 1 inch. Year: 2016. Price: $1,198,000. Contact: Luke Brown Yachts. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2016/Nordic-Tugs-49-2868769/Burlington/WA/United-States#.VbpOMVb0j8E Nordic Tugs Fullscreen The cozy pilothouse in the Nordic Tugs 49 doubles as an entertainment area with a bird's-eye view of the scenery both underway or in harbor. Nordic Tugs Fullscreen The height of cozy, this Nordic Tugs 49's stateroom has an island queen tucked into the bow peak. The 49 has accommodations for six people. Nordic Tugs Fullscreen The Selene 55 has a modern, graceful profile with a traditional pilothouse and an enclosed, hardtop flybridge. Length: 55 feet. Beam: 16 feet, 8 inches. Year: 2007. Price: $966,500. Contact: Grand Yachts Inc., Vancouver. For more information: http://www.yachtworld.com/boats/2007/Selene-55-Ocean-Trawler-2731257/Vancouver%2C-BC/Canada#.VaP0EVb0j8F Grand Yachts Fullscreen The Selene 55 has an open salon and galley finished in teak. An inlaid teak dining table lowers on a hydraulic cylinder to serve double duty as a coffee table. Aaron Lagadyn Fullscreen The VIP berth in the bow is one of three staterooms on the Selene 55, finished in teak with opening portlights and hatches to let in the ocean breeze. Aaron Lagadyn Fullscreen Like this topic?
